title: Walter Alston
summary: Walter Emmons Alston (December 1, 1911 â€“ October 1, 1984), nicknamed "Smokey", was an American baseball player and manager in Major League Baseball (MLB).[1] He is best known for managing the Brooklyn/Los Angeles Dodgers from 1954 through 1976, and signed 23 one-year contracts with the team.[2] He had a calm, reticent demeanor, for which he was sometimes also known as "The Quiet Man."
